column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////I came with a mixed group of international business partners
column2: and found that they really appreciated Spain's more 'eastern' tradition of sharing plates.  We were a large group
column3: so we ordered a  good mix of tapas & large dishes: bacon-wrapped dates (not as good as Toro in Boston
column8: and calamari. Then we got 1 of each of the brochetas (like a metal skewer that hangs from a pole on the table).  This was nice a great way to share with the others
column9: and the presentation was great.  After all of that meat
column10: we shared the seafood paella (note: we were 8 people).  We drank sangria throughout and it didn't disappoint.
